installation.script:
apt update
apt install --no-install-recommends -y curl unzip sed

if [[ ! -d /mnt/server ]]; then
  mkdir /mnt/server
fi

cd /mnt/server

# Delete old files for the clean reinstall
if [[ -f server-launcher.jar || -d mods || -d config || -d defaultconfigs ]]; then
  echo 'Removing old files... (mods, config and defaultconfigs files)'
  rm -rf server-launcher.jar mods config defaultconfigs
fi

# Download and unzip modpack server pack
echo 'Downloading server pack...'
curl -sSo server_pack.zip ${MODPACK_DOWNLOAD_LINK}
if [[ ! -f ./server_pack.zip ]]; then
  echo 'Error downloading server pack!'
  exit
fi
unzip -o server_pack.zip
if [[ ! -f ./variables.txt ]]; then
  echo 'variables.txt doesn''t exist, meaning the server pack zip file is probably corrupted or it''s not the right file...'
  exit
fi
echo 'Showing server pack''s variables (ignore java args as they are not going to be used).'
echo -e '\n'
cat variables.txt
echo -e '\n\n'

# Remove unnecessary files
rm server_pack.zip start.ps1

# No need for the server to auto start, so deleting last lines
awk '{print} /^eula$/ {exit}' start.sh | sed '$d' > installation.sh

# Rename server launcher
echo -e '\nmv $LAUNCHER_JAR_LOCATION server-launcher.jar' >> installation.sh

# Run install script
echo 'Running install script'
echo '-------------------------------------------'
bash installation.sh | tee install_logs.log
echo 'Install logs saved to install_logs.log'
echo '-------------------------------------------'

# Delete install files
rm installation.sh variables.txt start.sh

echo 'Install Complete.'

variables.name: Server pack download URL
variables.description: Modpack server pack download URL. Reinstall the server if installed already for this to take effect (this will only delete mods, config and defaultconfigs folders).
